author: icyJoseph
message:
fix: Combine the hrtime tuple to get a better seconds representation (#82687)

When building w/ webpack to calculate duration, we use `process.hrtime`
which is a tuple of integers [seconds, nanoseconds] - which means that
for sub second compiler runs, we end up showing total 0ms, or 1000ms (I
think)

- https://nodejs.org/api/process.html#processhrtimetime

With this PR we combine the seconds and nanoseconds into a float. 

### Before:

```console
   ▲ Next.js 15.4.6
   - Environments: .env.production

   Creating an optimized production build ...
 ✓ Compiled successfully in 0ms
   Skipping validation of types
```

### After

```console
   ▲ Next.js 15.4.6
   - Environments: .env.production

   Creating an optimized production build ...
 ✓ Compiled successfully in 813ms
   Skipping validation of types
```
